title: ICE using cross-crate unsafe_destructor w/ ?Sized params

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
Not sure whether this is part of the known bustage of `#[unsafe_destructor]`.

foo.rs:

``` rust
#![crate_type="lib"]

pub trait Trait { }
```

bar.rs:

``` rust
#![crate_type="lib"]
#![feature(unsafe_destructor)]

extern crate foo;

pub struct Instance<T: ?Sized>;

#[unsafe_destructor]
impl Drop for Instance<foo::Trait + 'static> {
    fn drop(&mut self) { }
}
```

main.rs:

``` rust
#![crate_type="bin"]

extern crate foo;
extern crate bar;

pub fn f(_: bar::Instance<foo::Trait>) { }

fn main() { }
```

Result:

```
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.0.0-dev (896cb36ec 2015-01-14 12:19:58 +0000)

$ for x in foo bar main; do RUST_BACKTRACE=1 rustc -L . $x.rs; done
error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: http://doc.rust-lang.org/complement-bugreport.html
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right) && (right == left)` (left: `9u32`, right: `0u32`)', /home/keegan/rust-master/src/librustc_trans/trans/base.rs:519

stack backtrace:

  11:     0x7fe42a1b5e00 - trans::base::trans_closure::hd102aedc0b2d0c0dw0t
```
